page.title: 05SCISSETT FROM 1915 cont.
page.content: There was a Grocers and Chinaware where Haywoods now stands.There wasn't a Dentists,it was a private house.The community centre belonged to the church and was called "The Parish Hall".Crofthouse Bakery was a Jewellers.There were open fields where Pennine Estate is.The Working Mens Club was at the back of Brown's Mill.Where the club is now, there was a field.The houses which stood where the Clinic is now,where condemmed and Sunnymead was built - the first part in 1937 and the last 12 houses in 1946.The Council Workshop was a decontamination centre during the Second World War.Beanlands Mill was the big building opposite the garage and Beanlands canteen was where the dairy is.The mill is now owned by Phoenix Textiles.
